intro: Ribes occidentale var. californicum, commonly known as California gooseberry, is a shrub native to western North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are small and usually pink or white. The berries, which are edible, are clustered and have a tart flavor, making them a valuable food source for wildlife.
